Notes.methods: Density calculated as [(N/A)/V][M]=D, where N=number of sleeping sites, A=area sampled in km2, V=mean number of days the nest remains visible, M=median nest group size, and D=number of weaned individuals/km2.

Site: Lagoas de Cufada Natural Park (woodland savannah)
Notes.methods: Density calculated as:D= n/[2w L P Pn I] where D is the density of the individuals, n is the number of nests detected, 2w is the transect width, L is the length of the transect, P is a function expressing the probability of detection at different distances, Pn refers to the nest production rate (1.09 nests/day/individual, adopted from Budongo), and I refers to the number of days between samplings
Reference: Sousa, J., Casanova, C., Barata, A. V., & Sousa, C. (2014). The effect of canopy closure on chimpanzee nest abundance in Lagoas de Cufada National Park, Guinea-Bissau. Primates, 55(2), 283-292.

Site: Lagoas de Cufada Natural Park (forest with a sparse canopy)
Notes.methods: Density calculated as:D= n/[2w L P Pn I] where D is the density of the individuals, n is the number of nests detected, 2w is the transect width, L is the length of the transect, P is a function expressing the probability of detection at different distances, Pn refers to the nest production rate (1.09 nests/day/individual, adopted from Budongo), and I refers to the number of days between samplings
Reference: Sousa, J., Casanova, C., Barata, A. V., & Sousa, C. (2014). The effect of canopy closure on chimpanzee nest abundance in Lagoas de Cufada National Park, Guinea-Bissau. Primates, 55(2), 283-292.

Site: Lagoas de Cufada Natural Park(dense-canopy forest)
Notes.methods: Density calculated as:D= n/[2w L P Pn I] where D is the density of the individuals, n is the number of nests detected, 2w is the transect width, L is the length of the transect, P is a function expressing the probability of detection at different distances, Pn refers to the nest production rate (1.09 nests/day/individual, adopted from Budongo), and I refers to the number of days between samplings
Reference: Sousa, J., Casanova, C., Barata, A. V., & Sousa, C. (2014). The effect of canopy closure on chimpanzee nest abundance in Lagoas de Cufada National Park, Guinea-Bissau. Primates, 55(2), 283-292.

Site: Eastern shore of Lake Tanganyika, Mahale Mountains
Notes.methods: Density obtained by multiplying group density by average group size.
Habitat: Forest (semi-deciduous vegetation with continuous multilayered canopy or discontinuous canopy of  high trees (>20m) with dense shrub, woody vine, herb, or grass species similar to those of the forest with close canopy. Secondary forest on abandoned farmland).
Reference: Uehara, S., & Ihobe, H. (1998). Distribution and abundance of diurnal mammals, especially monkeys, at Kasoje, Mahale Mountains, Tanzania. Anthropological Science, 106(4), 349-369.
